items.title: Global Money Chases World’s Hottest Major Stock Market in Korea
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- South Korean stocks, already this year’s best performers among the world’s major markets, are becoming a magnet for foreign investors as bold regulatory reforms to lift valuations and empower minority shareholders gain traction.Most Read from BloombergThe High Costs of Trump’s ‘Big Beautiful’ New Car Loan DeductionCan This Bridge Ease the Troubled US-Canadian Relationship?Trump Administration Sues NYC Over Sanctuary City PolicyJust this month, policymakers voted in favor of pivota

items.title: Rising Fiscal Deficits Drive Billions Into Credit
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- Investors are showing signs of pulling money out of government bonds and plowing it into US and European company debt. items.title: Jim Cramer on Goldman Sachs: “I’m a Believer”
items.description: The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (NYSE:GS) is one of the stocks that Jim Cramer looked at. A caller asked if the company’s private credit unit will continue doing highly leveraged deals like the one in the Walgreens-Shields transaction. Cramer replied: “I don’t know. items.title: Should You Really Buy Stocks as the S&P 500 Roars by Record Highs? History Gives a Shocking Answer.
items.author: Trevor Jennewine
items.description: Historical data suggests investing in the S&P 500 during record highs can yield better returns than random day investments, contrary to investor fears. While current market conditions show a premium valuation, cautious investment in high-conviction ideas is recommended.
